author: Odeinoichus
title: Not the Costume for Her.
review:
Set #71017 Pink Power Batgirl: When first trying on different costumes Barbara Gordon was seen briefly in this variant costume, ultimately she didn't like it, however it does look very impressive.

PPB, not to be mistake for PPG, is a very impressive looking Minifigure. She's got dual-molded legs with pink booties on the bottom and minor printing for a tutu/bikini bottom looking leg print. She's wearing the new skirt piece first seen in the LEGO Disney Minifigure series, her cape is pink and made with shimmery looking material. She has a pink batarang and her hair piece is unique to her with a nice ponytail in the back. She features two expressions, the happy smiling one and a very displeased frown, she definitely doesn't like this costume.

Overall I'd recommend this one, I like the overall look of it and the parts are very enticing, especially that Batarang. Highly recommended.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: A fine variant, but not very noteworthy in the overall series!
review:
Opening;

Pink Power Batgirl was only briefly featured in 2017s 'The LEGO Batman Movie' and is in no way a bad Minifigure, however compared to some greats of the series, she isn't very impactful.

The Minifigure -

She uses the Barbara Gordon hair with a band printed, a mask is printed on both sides of the head accompanying a smiling and stern face print, she has a shiny pink cape, a printed torso with the arms subsequently printed, a pink skirt hip attachment and some dual moulded legs with some minor printing.

The accessory -

Her single accessory is a dark pink Batarang which is cool and appropriate. The stand is the standard black CMF stand.

In conclusion -

This is a good Minifigure, there is no doubt about that, but compared to the other 19 of the series, she just isn't that interesting, therefore I can only really recommend this to people who want them all.
